synthesis.output: Implemented a TypeScript build pipeline by creating a custom `build.ts` script and `tsconfig.build.json` to handle Bun-specific import extensions. The script successfully transpiles 119 files, rewrites import paths to `.js`, and generates declaration files, enabling the codebase to run natively on Node.js. Verified the setup by building the project and confirming the CLI tool executes correctly with Node.js.

Removed the `serve` command and the entire `src/web/` visualization directory, including Hono and React-based components. Updated `bin/work.ts` to remove subcommand registration and verified that `package.json` had no lingering dependencies. TypeScript compilation passed successfully, confirming a clean removal of the feature.

Updated `packages/workstreams/package.json` with essential fields for NPM publishing, including `main`, `types`, modernized `exports`, and a `prepublishOnly` script. Configured metadata such as repository, license, and keywords, while restricting the `files` array to distribution artifacts and README. All tasks were successfully completed, ensuring the package is ready for distribution with proper TypeScript support.

Completed the build verification for the "Npm Publish Cleanup" workstream, ensuring the package builds correctly and exports necessary TypeScript declarations. Verified the global CLI installation via `bun link` and confirmed that all core commands function as expected using the compiled code. The workstream is now 100% complete with all 22 tasks successfully addressed.

Updated both the root and package-level README files to include comprehensive instructions for global installation via npm and bun. The documentation now clearly explains how to use the `work` command globally and provides distinct options for source-based development or package-only installation.
